results.title: Stir
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallace, Richard Brennan, New South Wales Film Corporation and Smiley Films
results.brief_description: A tense, realistic Australian drama which examines the barbarity and cruelty that exists within an Australian jail for male prisoners. Bryan Brown stars as a young but experienced convict determined to protest against the mindless, and often dehumanising, rules and limitations placed on prisoners. The script-writer, Bob Jewson, was a prisoner at Bathurst Goal in 1974 and he has based his script for “Stir” on the events and personalities which led to the infamous rioting at that institution. “Stir” culminates in a similar explosive finish. Cast also includes Max Phipps, Dennis Miller, Gary Waddell, Phil Motherwell, Edward Robshaw, Michael Gow and Robert ‘Tex’ Morton. Written by Bob Jewson. Photography by Geoff Burton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Wallace, Richard Brennan, New South Wales Film Corporation and Smiley Films

results.title: Steps of the ballet
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Alexander Shaw and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: Deals with the creation of a ballet. The basic positions, movements and steps are demonstrated. The dancers’ steps are explained by Robert Helpmann, famous ballet dancer and choreographer. The film ends with the presentation of a new ballet to show how the arts of dancing, music and painting join together in its creation. Featured dancers include Alexander Grant (New Zealand), Elaine Fifield, Gordon Hamilton (Australia), Gerd Larsen, Peter Wright (United Kingdom), with Joan Harris (United Kingdom) as Ballet Mistress. Narrated by Robert Helpmann.

results.title: Still killing us softly
results.creator_credit: Margaret Margaret Lazarus and Cambridge Documentary Films
results.brief_description: In this program, Jean Kilbourne examines images in advertising. She explores the relationship of media images to actual problems in society, such as the channelling of men and women into traditional roles and occupations, economic discrimination against women, the sexual abuse of children, rape and other forms of violence, pornography, sexual harassment, teenage pregnancy and eating disorders.

results.title: Stephane Grappelli in Concert
results.brief_description: Filmed at the Dallas Brookes Hall, Melbourne, on 26th August 1975. At 75 years of age and with a career spanning more than 60 years, Stephane Grappelli is considered the world’s greatest living jazz violinist. This concert features Grappelli with the Diz Disley Trio.

results.title: Steve Waugh
results.creator_credit: Stephen Phillips and Australian Cricket Video
results.brief_description: Australia’s tenth Test captain, Steve Waugh, carries some 14 years experience at cricket’s highest level. Only Alan Border has scored more Test runs for Australia, and no-one has played more one-day internationals. A hero at home, a world beater away, the feats of Steve Waugh have become legend the world over. This is an exceptional insight into the story of a great sportsman in his own words.

results.title: Steve Mcqueen Man on the Edge
results.brief_description: An acknowledged star, he was also an intensely private man. Despite accolades and huge earnings in his own mind he remained a street kid who made it. This film includes clips from his greatest films, never-before-seen home movies and interviews with directors, producers, agents, fellow actors, friends and family members.

results.title: Steeltown
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, Wolf Koenig, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A portrait of Hamilton, the Pittsburgh or Birmingham of Canada. This is a rich and colorful subject that encourages imaginative treatment on the screen. The heart of the city is the immense complex of furnaces and rolling mills, but nearby are the lake, the mountain, and the rich fruit farms. How the work of the steel mills touches the city and its surroundings is shown in many views during both day and night.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rex Tasker, Wolf Koenig, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Starting from scratch
results.creator_credit: Alastair Matheson, Horst Cerni, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and UNICEF
results.brief_description: The determined people of Tanzania in East Africa are “starting from scratch” to build up their country’s health, education and welfare services. We meet two women, typical of the many helping to build Tanzania’s future: Aurelia, a teacher trained with UNICEF assistance, and Mageta, a dietician travelling from village to village.

results.title: Step by step
results.creator_credit: Faith Hubley, Hubley Studios and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Created in honour of the International Year of the Child, film director Faith Hubley interprets the world of childhood - as it was, as it is now, and as it might be. Distinctive animated children of every race and nationality appear on the screen, accompanied by the voices of children chanting in Spanish and French, with key phrases spoken in English. Viewers see the bleakness of childhood throughout history, the full range of childhood experiences - from poverty to plenty, work to leisure, and the possibilities of the future when the basic rights of children are recognised by us all. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Step-By-Step Guide to Form S
results.brief_description: This video has been designed to help you work through your Tax Return step by step. Each question on Form S is explained in plain language and, where appropriate, examples are given. Numbers on the screen tell you which question on the form you are working on.
